title: Irakere - Misa Negra (1986)
description:
Ã¢â‚¬Å“Misa NegraÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (1986) is one of the best of the post-Paquito (D'Rivera) and Arturo (Sandoval) Irakere groupings and recordings of the 80s. It shows why Chucho Valdes' group has remained atop the heap and continues undisputed as the most important jazz ensemble in Cuban history.
 
'Misa Negra,' the four part suite written in 1969 by Jesus "Chucho" ValdÃƒÂ©s, from which this Irakere album takes its name, is a musical description of the Yoruba religious ceremony which is still practiced to this day in Cuba. Anthropologically, an important album for anyone interested in native Cuban culture
. 
 The playing and arrangements are hot, sweaty and inspiring. An ear and eye opening recording that will have your jaw dragging the floor.
 
 Cuban jazz at its best.
 
 Highly Recommended.


Irakere

 Misa Negra

 1986

  

  CD / 1991 / 320Kbps



Tracklist:

 1. Concierto Para Metales

 2. Misa Negra: 

 - Part I-Rezo
 - Part II-Acercamiento
 - Part III-Llegada Y Desarrollo
 - Part IV-Despedida

 3. Samba Para Enrique

 4. El Duke


Recorded at Tonstudio Bauer, Ludwigsburg, Germany in November 1986


Irakere:

 Chucho Valdes: Piano, keyboards

 Jorge Alfonso: Congas

 Oscar Valdes: Cuban percussion

 Jorge Varona: Trumpet

 German Velasco: Sax, flute

 Jose Luis Cortes: Sax, flute

 Carlos Averhoff: Sax, flute

 Juan Mungula: Trumpet

 Carlos Morales: Guitar

 Carlos Del Puerto: Bass

 Enrique Pla: Drums


Irakere / Misa Negra / 1986
